sentences.chinese: 陳丞相平者，陽武戶牖鄉人也。
sentences.literal: Prime Minister Chen Ping was a native of Huyou village in Yangwu.

sentences.chinese: 少時家貧，好讀書，有田三十畝，獨與兄伯居。
sentences.literal: In his youth his family was poor, but he loved reading books. He had thirty mu of fields and lived only with his elder brother Bo.
Bo constantly tilled the fields, allowing Ping to travel and study.
Ping was tall and handsome in appearance.

sentences.chinese: 人或謂陳平曰：「貧何食而肥若是？」
sentences.literal: Someone said to Chen Ping: 'Though poor, how do you eat to become so plump?'

sentences.chinese: 其嫂嫉平之不視家生產，曰：「亦食糠覈耳。
sentences.literal: His sister-in-law resented that Ping did not oversee the family production and said: 'He also eats only bran and husks.
Having an uncle like this, it would be better to have none.'
Bo heard this and drove away his wife, divorcing her.

sentences.chinese: 及平長，可娶妻，富人莫肯與者，貧者平亦恥之。
sentences.literal: When Ping grew up and was of marriageable age, rich families would not give their daughters to him, and Ping also disdained poor families.

sentences.chinese: 久之，戶牖富人有張負，張負女孫五嫁而夫輒死，人莫敢娶。
sentences.literal: After a long time, there was a rich man in Huyou named Zhang Fu. Zhang Fu's granddaughter had married five times, and each husband died, so no one dared marry her.

sentences.chinese: 邑中有喪，平貧，侍喪，以先往後罷為助。
sentences.literal: There was a funeral in the town. Ping was poor and attended the funeral, helping by arriving early and leaving late.

sentences.chinese: 張負既見之喪所，獨視偉平，平亦以故後去。
sentences.literal: Zhang Fu saw him at the funeral site and gazed admiringly at Ping alone. Ping also deliberately left late.

sentences.chinese: 負隨平至其家，家乃負郭窮巷，以獘席為門，然門外多有長者車轍。
sentences.literal: Fu followed Ping to his home. The home was in a poor alley outside the city walls, with a tattered mat as a door, yet outside the door there were many ruts from noblemen's carriages.

sentences.chinese: 張負歸，謂其子仲曰：「吾欲以女孫予陳平。」
sentences.literal: Zhang Fu returned and told his son Zhong: 'I wish to give my granddaughter to Chen Ping.'
